command

Class CalculatePi

  • java.lang.Object
    • command.CalculatePi
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Command, java.io.Serializable

    public class CalculatePi
extends java.lang.Object
implements Command, java.io.Serializable
    This command calculates Pi up to a certain decimal. Most of the code for this class is from the Oracle Tutorial for RMI: https://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/rmi
    Author:
    Alexandru Jaravete
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      The constructor prepares all information's for the calculation.

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public void execute()
        Description copied from interface: Command
        Method to be executed.
        Specified by:
        execute in interface Command

      • calculate

        public void calculate()
        Compute the value of pi to the specified number of digits after the decimal point. The value is computed using Machin's formula: pi/4 = 4*arctan(1/5) - arctan(1/239) and a power series expansion of arctan(x) to sufficient precision.

      • arctan

        public java.math.BigDecimal arctan(int inverseX,
                                   int scale)
        Compute the value, in radians, of the arctangent of the inverse of the supplied integer to the specified number of digits after the decimal point. The value is computed using the power series expansion for the arc tangent: arctan(x) = x - (x^3)/3 + (x^5)/5 - (x^7)/7 + (x^9)/9 ...
        Parameters:
        inverseX -
        scale -
        Returns:
        arctangent in radians

      • returnResult

        public void returnResult()
        Returns the result to the callback object.
